instruction: I need you to prep the 'Marketing_Dept_Shared' browser profile for the external compliance audit happening next Tuesday. It's been running slow and looks cluttered. Just tighten up the privacy configurations, clean out all the accumulated junk, and make sure it's secure and ready for the auditors to look at. I'm heading into a meeting, so handle this for me so we don't get flagged.

evaluator.criterion: The agent must perform a comprehensive audit preparation routine, not just a simple cleanup. Key implicit steps include: 1. Creating a backup of the current profile before making destructive changes. 2. Scanning and selectively disabling non-compliant extensions rather than removing everything. 3. Clearing cache and history but verifying critical login cookies are preserved or noted. 4. Checking deep security settings (TLS, popups, tracking) beyond just 'privacy'. 5. Generating a pre-audit report to confirm compliance. If the agent simply wipes history and blocks cookies, it fails due to operational disruption.
